headline: Three Reasons Why KDP is Risky and One Stock to Buy Instead
summary: Over the last six months, Keurig Dr Pepper’s shares have sunk to $32.08, producing a disappointing 5.5% loss - a stark contrast to the S&P 500’s 11.1% gain. This may have investors wondering how to approach the situation.

headline: KDP Declines 10% in 3 Months: Time to Buy, Hold or Sell the Stock?
summary: Keurig Dr Pepper faces headwinds in coffee and still beverages but shows resilience through strong refreshment beverage growth and strategic brand innovations.
